9wfdqrMnpv5w5y_dHkGXLQ.text: This was one of the smaller chinese buffets I have seen. Everything was pretty decent. The sesame chicken stood out to me and everybody and their mama was loading up on the butter shrimp. The lunch buffet is about $8 and that seems pretty fair.  There were no major negatives. It's a solid place. But it's by no means outstanding. Nothing made me think to myself that this was going to be in my regular rotation.

0j7N5Mhy5lqNUkxCteIuSg.text: Best Chinese buffet in the city. Food is always fresh, but the fried rice needs improvement. Service is always helpful. Prices are great and although the place is about 10 years old, it still keeps a nice atmosphere. It gets very busy during weekdays lunch hours.

BmqtHBr6gCGjQ0grKKbQyw.text: I dont mind a good buffet, although when I see too much food spread out all at once, I mysteriously lose my appetite (?) But Dragon buffet is one I will always fall back on when Im hit with a sudden asian buffet craving.    I love their buttered shrimp, although you have have lady luck with you when they bring them out.  People pile them in their plates higher than the himalayas!  I mean, c'mon people, Im right behind you praying that Ill get alteast 2 pieces!  But they are that good.  Greed will take over when you taste them.  I also get the green beans, which they load with garlic (a good thing if you dont plan on a smooch-fest later), soy glazed mushrooms, a fake crab casserole, scallops with zucchini, etc.  Soups are yummy too and they even have a dumpling section (but its pork, so I didnt taste it).  Sometimes they have Singapore noodles, which has a good curry flavor other times its just lo-mein.  They even have sea bass and salmon on the buffet (not all the time, I guess its seasonal) They offer good options for vegetarians and pescatarians like myself.  I didnt bother looking at the other protein dishes but they're good and plenty.  Crab rangoons are too cream cheesy, but doesnt stop me from eating them.  A good deal for under $8.00 for lunch.

VyAZMVWnFMtS0_NIUNUzbg.text: Assuming you're looking for a Chinese buffet (Why else would you go somewhere named "DRAGON BUFFET"?) you'll find satisfaction here.  The place is clean and the decor is pleasing.  The selection is pretty good and the location is convenient.  I like to come here when I get burned out on Royal Panda (also nearby).  Try the Indian Chicken and the Mongolian Beef.  Both are very good!

X1IdnPwa_wpARFf7bnjuPA.text: One of the better Chinese buffets.  My only complaint is the last time we went, there were at least 5 fish dishes and only 1 spicy dish.  They need to add more spicy.  Parking is at a premium but the service and taste make up for it.

qsMWeeuaVY_na12egYnclw.text: This place is legitimately decent compared to a lot of Chinese buffets in Charlotte.  First of all its a clean and cozy atmosphere.  The coconut chicken is awesome, butter shrimp is awesome.  My only knock is they don't switch up the menu at all and put different things out there.  I'm sure they are trying to save money and not have to buy tons of product to keep switching out....but still.  I'd like to see a few more dishes with shrimp or even something with scallops.  I will continue to eat here when I cannot afford Tin Tin.  This place deserves a solid 4 stars for a Chinese buffet....start varying the menu and I will give you a 5.

jLs3E_7JfrnXMUTkc0igqw.text: Hours later and I'm not sick. This place gets the mediocre at best award.

v3XHNUmcYmwYIdaxw-6kIg.text: Dragon Buffet is a decent, competitively-priced Asian buffet that is within close proximity to my office.  The buffet is almost entirely meat.  Don't get me wrong; their selection of different Asian style meats were great, but I would have appreciated more choices of vegetables other that just buttered broccoli and limp cabbage.  My favorite food from the buffet was their their "baked crabmeat".  It was imitation crab, but still tasted great.  Good thing I'm generally a fan of cheap white fish.  Their service wasn't the best.  While we were being seated, our host got distracted by something and just forgot about us.  Our waitress got my friend's drink order wrong, too.  All this must have been due to the fact that the place was filled nearly to capacity.  At $6.95 for an adult weekday lunch buffet, I'll certainly give Dragon Buffet another shot.

lZ0iqgQsz07qcI18X54SJg.text: I'll admit to being a Chinese buffet junkie. I've sought out all the buffets in the Pineville, south Charlotte area, and this one does it better than the rest. I see some of the other reviews complain about lack of selection here, but for my tastes, this is far and away the best. The dishes I like here are mostly chicken, and they have quite a few varied styles which are really tasty. You have to accept that its a BUFFET, so the classic dishes you might order in a fancy place are not all available, but what's there is excellent every visit. You cannot do better anywhere for a $10.00 buffet !!

_TdLyiizqn-Wh4YeKYej0A.text: Do not eat here. There are bugs in the food!!!  They pretty much forced us to pay because we had already started eating. They threatened if we didn't pay they would call the police, bugs or no bugs. Disgusting!! I tried to snap a photo and the lady I complained to took the plate from my hand before I could. So gross!

ySRkorNU9XF_tOx4M065kQ.text: Good, cheap chinese food.  All you can eat for lunch on a Sunday for $7.95?  Sure!  Why not?!  You can also take out food for around $3.50/lb.  Nothing particularly special, but clean and nice staff.  Food is refreshed regularly so you are not staring at empty trays.  The fantasy chicken was something I haven't had before and I was pleasantly surprised.  It could use more desserts in my opinion, but having apple pie a la mode satisified my sweet tooth.

NVVWwv40wLtMrlMWO2Ei4Q.text: I wanted Bill Spoons today, but didn't have cash and was too lazy to drive to an ATM. I'll see you next time Bill, next time. So, Chinese it was!   3.5 stars to no avail so 4 it is. Dragon Buffet isn't the greatest place, but its far from being the worst. It is though, my preferred Chinese restaurant in the Billy Graham area.   Typically, I too normally avoid Chinese buffets, less tin tin. Dragon Buffet though, is a restaurant in which I prefer the buffet. All of the dishes I've ordered off the menu here have been horrible. Orange chicken was atrocious. The sauce they use for their sweet and sour dishes taste nothing more than diluted strawberry jam. Hot and spicy beef was lacking the spicy and the flavor. So, I avoid the menu altogether and go straight to the buffet - even for my to go orders.   Their buffet offers a nice variety of items. Mongolian beef, sesame chicken, and the usuals etc. but I have my favorites:  #1 is the buttered shrimp. Can't go wrong with tempura fried shrimp!  #2 is the Indonesian or Malay chicken..I think. My memory fails me worse than I failed the series 7. I forget if it was malay or indonesian and I was just there an hour ago, lol.  #3 is the fried rice. Abnormally brown as heck, not the greatest tasting and greasier than fried chicken, but dang I can't get enough of it.  #4 (kudos if you caught this earlier, lol) is the fantasy chicken. I can only eat one or two pieces though. This chicken is made in a sweet, I think mayonnaise type sauce. Very strange, and unique. It isn't the greatest, but different.   And all else, I get a sampling of the potatoes, mushrooms, and cabbage. Sometimes I get the imitation crab bake that looks like a casserole. This too has some type of sour cream or mayonnaise sauce. It is unique but isn't for everyone though.   They have been recently offering pad thai at the buffet. But the pad thai is made with clear vermicelli noodles. That should be a crime. It looks strikingly similar to a Filipino dish called pancit. In fact, it taste more like pancit than pad thai too. Skip that.   Today I also saw a new item, the shrimp biscuit. Dough stuffed with some type of shrimp and mayonnaise concoction. Different again, but I didn't like this one.   I also asked for a cup of hot oil/chili today. It was interesting. Call me crazy, but it tasted like the chili on the outside those mexican mango chili lollipops. I dunno if that's a bad thing?   To go orders at the Buffet cost $3.95 a pound. If you splurge, you might end up with a $15 dollar to go box. If you only get what you want and don't fall victim to temptation and pack a sampling of everything thats out, you can make out pretty well.   edit - service is always good here.They are very friendly and the restaurant is very clean too.   All in all, Dragon Buffet isn't the best chinese place, but I've acquired a taste for it and can't seem to get enough.

GfNzt2hKvpm5QvXasTwqvQ.text: Worst food ever for health conscious eaters.  Most of the selection was too greasy and had way too much breading, with very little healthy choices of fruits and veggies. The sushi was a lame effort. Indigestion lasted 15 hours.  Don't go.

wmY-GNK2wqC70vj6adUokg.text: I was not impressed by this place at all. The food was strange and there was no sushi. I probably won't be coming back here again.

zfS1-RnUSUa2A6tXDt37xg.text: For a Chinese Buffet, this place isn't that bad! Lots of choices, food usually fresh and hot and the restaurant is clean. If I am looking to eat a variety of Chinese dishes, I usually come here. If I am craving a particular dish, there are better places to go.

hwTc6B2NACKPU7kOmIGSHA.text: I am not a fan of buffet but the food was not bad. The place seems clean and the waitress just can't wait to take your empty plate away.   So sure I'll come back... some time next year. And no, won't write home about the experience.

IiX4nJQrmaXGtr4fTPoY4g.text: They do serve carry-outs, meaning you fill out whatever you want off the buffet - and they weight it.  Price won't break the bank - for sure! :) I really could not dine inside and stuff my mouth, for the sake of dollar's worth. Feeling so bloated afterwards. Buffet carry-outs defy IS worth every dollar AND I still can save some for later in the ref. :)

-yrOyM3WNjWnpTYN8tGgvw.text: This is one of my favorite Chinese food places in Charlotte, although some of the dishes on the buffet aren't that great. Avoid the orange chicken and the bourbon chicken. The Vietnamese spring rolls are fantastic, although I have no idea what meat they're stuffed with - it's probably better that I don't know. They also have several really good unusual dishes, try the Malaysia chicken and the Indian chicken.

MueX-bCx_BrOXZsJWx0WeA.text: I sometimes stop by this place when I'm around the area.  The very first time I ate there, the food was fantastic.  After that initial visit, it sorta went downhill somewhat.  This place is always packed around lunch time (weekdays).  Not sure if that's because all the other Chinese place are not buffet setup.  The only real negative about it is the small variety of dishes on the buffet line.  I wish they had more things to choose from.

gjH2VohXt9bKOq5PdjKyVQ.text: food was good not great, the butter popcorn shrimp was better the other places. Cost was averge we dined in and try most of the food. Was standard mixed buffet. not a lot of asian food, sushi was not good.  The place needs make over dull and no shine to the place.

MTs5GOV30IXF9QCOl9lfPg.text: I have gone to Dragon for several years and the food has always been pretty good for a buffet. The food is always the same, but has always tasted pretty yummy. They make sure the food is always stocked, their servers are friendly, and the price is under $10.   There really isn't a whole lot to say, it's a buffet. It is the best buffet in town and I highly recommend going! Just make sure you go after 12pm because it's pretty packed and it can get hot in there.

diwtAbd_KoJZNhALIncSAg.text: Amazing place to eat. The food is fantastic and cheap. You may not want to go on Sunday afternoons because it always has a large church crowd.

5IMsan3Xa1iHYeGYdNCGDQ.text: I would give 0 stars if the app would let me. I had a terrible experience at Dragon Buffet off of S. Tryon St. this weekend. I should have realized my mistake when the trays were scarcely empty with just 2-3 pieces in them. I kept being told by servers that more food would be out in a couple minutes.  I decided to "snack" on what was left while waiting for the food to be replenished. My husband chose not to eat at all in his disappointment. Still no food was brought out. We ended up calling it a loss and paid the full adult buffet charge and left. About an hour after getting home; I started to feel really sick...stomach cramps and nauseated.  This soon turned into an "all nighter" of running back and forth to the bathroom being sick and feeling absolutely miserable for 2 days. After researching the North Carolina Public Health Inspections I can see why. Wish I would have reviewed that first.  Please learn from my mistake and misery and pass on this place who would rather take short cuts instead of considering others well being.

aTgU5UgNzOwUxoAHGCLmXw.text: I'm going to disclaimer this review & the 2 stars from the start & say that I almost always despise buffets. So if you actually enjoy the buffet style (which boggles my mind), then you may actually think Dragon Buffet is worthy of a higher rating. But the combination of buffet & Chinese (also another non fav of mine) doesn't really bode well for this review.  The food actually does taste pretty good for buffet food, from orange chicken, to beef & broccoli, to all your favs, they have quite a bit on tap. They have the usual rice options, & I actually enjoyed the vegetarian egg rolls. But I wouldn't recommend the ice cream, it's just a little too dicey for me. So they do have plenty of options & I'm sure a Chinese buffet fan would love to peruse the options all lined up for the taking. And along with the set price & rapid quick seating & service, I can see why people keep this place quite packed.  I probably won't be heading back here anytime soon, but they do have plenty of Chinese food options for a good price. So bring your appetite along with an open mind (if you're like me).

eVLxzgkmRbjLe29R4PMjEQ.text: I didn't like the food at all and the ambience isn't great either I wouldn't recommend this to anyone

8JQskkZBlZCJtr9bHwqM7w.text: This is a nice establishment. Workers were Very polite, even the greeter who answers the phone was patient, & assisted me over the phone with finding the location lol. However my waiter seemed to be aggravated for whatever reason. Oan: Their food bar looked appealing, with a pretty nice variety. Their sauteed broccoli is good, as the same with their salmon. Both I would give an 8/10.  I'm not that great of a fan of the chicken in the chicken & broccoli, but again the broccoli is more legit. I'm definitely a fan of their teriyaki chicken, it seems as though it was grilled on an outdoor grill (some may not be a fan of it having those little partial burnt flakes, but I love grilled food). I usually love sesame chicken but I'm Really not a fan of theirs, to the extent it's about an 3 or 4/10. Also I'm a BIG sweet tea fan and theirs is horrible... Lol Maybe i caught the bad/older pitchers that was made, but it was just terrible..

yEoWQqy_crYiDoQ9CAy5Jw.text: Convenient, however my first experience the food was extremely greasy, and over seasoned.  I went this past week and I figured I would get vegetables and salmon is on the buffet, however within 30 minutes I was in the bathroom constantly and it was so bad it was better I just stayed at work because I didn't think I could make the drive home.

ehcc-CCnSbl8_gRo8TI2ZA.text: With so many Chinese food places in the area this one has to be my 1st choice. I've sampled others so no, I'm not being biased. I rarely eat buffet style here, I typically just order to go and I am happy with it. One thing so will say is that sometimes they will charge extra for pork fried rice and etc, so make sure you check it because on more then one instance they didn't add the meat and I was charged for it. I wish they delivered and is would give 5 stars.

CXhIZ1M3UIZJEvBhUAY0Zg.text: Been here a bunch of times, never dissapoints for $8. Good variety and they are constantly refreshing the food trays. Me and friends from work go here for lunch 1, twice a month. Best cheap Chinese I've found in the CLT area over the last 4 years.

5NyOV1yaipv9FpiHRriDwg.text: Food is fresh and good!  If you like asian buffets, this is one of the better ones.  Lunch is always full, but they move people in and out fairly quickly.

E1yUn2orUfGL5rN4qvD_ag.text: Love the tempura shrimp and the chicken & broccoli. They are consistent and have a great flavor to most of the foods, which keeps me going back.

LcgzYr13ycxq8EZoe3XNFA.text: First of all its chinese then buffet. I was here with my collagues, oh my ... i dont know what they are using instead of meat. its was lack of spices than no way to hide the poor quality of the meat. And long line...i really dont understand people. Chinese food needs attention. And should be always prepared as orrder. Not like buffet and waiting on the counter too long. I wont be back and will make my collagues not to come back again neither.

3Y6-K-MmkGv3zfhGhqWGMQ.text: I dont really go to buffets, mostly because the food sits out a long time if there arent many people at the place. Dragon Buffet is different. This place is very busy at all times. I have never eaten inside at the table. Always takeout. It is such a steal. My boyfriend and I go, grab a to go box and fill it up. Usually with their perfectly steamed rice, bourbon chicken, great broccoli and usually some of the good ol General Tsao chicken. We fill up the box and we both eat for under 11 bucks. To sit is much more but still totally affordable.

48p6R_YTHXuBfjJqt1ayBQ.text: Unpredictable each visit.  Checked the county health code web site and decided to stop going.

Jmn8P8YXOUhwQjIjQI1oQQ.text: This was one of the best Chinese buffets I've been too, the  chicken tasted like good chicken all very fresh and juicy nothing was dried out. Great crab Rangoon that is one of my favorite things at Chinese restaurant and those were the best I've ever had. The fantasy chicken was incredible. I enjoyed every piece of my meal from beginning to being able to scoop my own strawberry & cookies and cream ice cream :) yumm. The only thing that would make this place better is if the wait staff were more friendly.

fSdJfwW4YJwDdnanNSon-A.text: For $6.99, it is a solid lunch spot (and probably the cheapest around for chinese buffet). They have all the basic items. I particularly enjoy the spring rolls they offer here (looks like a firecracker stuffed with minced meat). Their entree choices do not all taste alike (thank goodness), and you can easily get your month's worth in 2 trips (or even 1).

9TiQ87UeX7h9W4F6kGc9Xg.text: I come to this place a lot.   My favorite Item that has me tossin in the bed like i'm going through withdraws are the BUTTER POPCORN SHRIMP. The butter shrimp here will make u "wanna slap yo momma"  Service is FAST. I've had everthing on the buffet.. EXCEPT the sushi, salad bar (u should see it..) & desserts... I DON'T have ONE sweet tooth in my mouth.. wierd huh??  the dinner prices are about 7.95 i do believe.  Lo Mein Beef & Broccoli Spring Rolls  hey... u get the picture. They also have a little window where you can see them cooking. Cant beat that right??  *** I've heard some music in here that made me wonder if they were trying to be funny or Muzak was on strike.  I've read "This place isn't bad to be located in a strip mall" soooo many times it makes me wonder why is THAT a issue. FOODIE SHRUGS  like Andrew Zimmer says... if it looks good...... EAT IT!!!  CHEERS

1uHJDdjklpoGCE0fuSX7dA.text: I've had better and I've had worst too. I loved some of the food but the sushi was a big disappointment. They have the heat all the time and its uncomfortable in the booths.

PwQlBk8z0DczK9UnnvnHdQ.text: This restaurant has the most presentable and clean dining area compared to other Chinese buffet restaurants. I will rate the physical aspect of the restaurant as 4 stars. The food tastes okay but not to a point where you will look forward to eating the same food in the near future. I'll give the food taste 3 stars. In terms of the food offered, there's not much you can select from. For the food menu and selection I give it 2 stars. But what about the $$$? I give it 5 stars. You can't complain much with $8+ dinner. Am I going to come back here? Yes why not. It's cheap!

CXRYR9fBsR2wybnulbozXw.text: This was certainly the best Chinese buffer I've ever eaten.  The was a vast variety of different kinds of Chinese food, and to my surprise, the food was excellent.  I tried ~12-14 of their dishes including a variety of rices and each and every one was delicious.  I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Dragon Buffet - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taken from Google Maps

XEpu914mnhN0tyickczxTA.text: Cheap and fast. You get what you pay for. Probably would have been more stars if the server hadn't given us the check when we first started eating. A bit rude and basically telling us to hurry up and go. Very busy for lunch.

czO1UbDL-zvCj0AX39Ilsw.text: "This is a 3.5" rating. I do not like buffets of any type. My perception is always mediocre food and potential for food safety issues, not to mention the idiots with no social skills mishandling the serving utensils and sticking their fingers in the food.   I have been hard pressed to find good Chinese food in the Charlotte area and this restaurant was recommended by a friend, who knows "buffet" is a bad concept in my world. So, it had to be good if they went out on the limb to get me to go there.   I visit this restaurant only for lunch. I can get in and out quickly even when its crowded, which is 99% of the time.  They pack them in because the price is right. About $9.50 for the buffet, ice tea and tip.   The food quality is a pleasant surprise. I do not think anything is off the mark and they are consistent. The food taste the same every time. They definitely use high quality ingredients and overall good food is the end result. They offer many choices of chicken, shrimp and beef. Excellent soup and items for vegetarians. Great depth and breadth in their offering.  I would recommend this restaurant because of the above average price/value relationship. Very good service and nice owners. Its still a bufffffffet though!  Parking can be difficult when they are slammed. Just pull in the Home Depot lot and walk across the street for the no hassel approach.

2rj-vKhKUu72rJ_nJNUKYg.text: After spending the day at Carowinds, Our Family decided to eat here after searching YELP for a buffet style restraunt to eat at.  Prior reviews seemed favorable so Dragon Buffet  was the choice.  Easy access off 485 & Tryon. We arrived around 3:30, no waiting and only a couple other families were eating.  My wife and I, along with our 5 boys ( 17, 16, 14, 10 , 7 ) were seated, ordered our drinks, and then went to the bufett.  They have a great selection, including Sushi.  The food was great, some buffets the food is dried out from sitting so long. the staff was very attentitive to the buffet, keeping it clean and stocked. Desert Bar and 4 selections of Ice Cream!  the restraunt itself was clean and attractive  The best part was of course feeding a family of 7 for $54  I do not know if prices change in the evening, but I can say Dragon Buffet will be a regular stop for us when we are in the area!

ONUH06krcx52JLsT-26Ctw.text: I am not a big fan of buffets, but my 13-yo son adores buffets, especially Chinese food buffets so we frequent Dragon Buffet almost on a monthly basis.  We have tried just about every Chinese Buffet in the area and, with the exception of the expensive (but well worth it) Tin Tin, Dragon Buffet is our favorite.  We have dined there at various days and times and the food is consistently good.  It is also very reasonably priced, since they don't have crab legs.  The restaurant is very clean, the service is very good and the food is always fresh.  Give it a try...you won't be disappointed.

gsZySDi1cdebkxCWqM2WDw.text: Great staff good food Chinese never fails I don't go here as much as I should but when I do go I love getting the buffet to go they don't have that many selections but it's pretty good for the most part

1L4y7o3Dj2b8jKb4m8W93g.text: Nice food for reasonable price. There was enough variety too especially in the dessert section. What got me was the attitude of the staff. The most unfriendly and rude staff you could ever find. Not just that but everytime I filled my plate I actually observed them scanning through the plate. It was like you are eating portion of their food and now they are upset about it. It was unnecessary and weird. They should really look into grooming their staff or simply replace if they dont understand the concept of customer care or hospitality. They are the only reason why one would think twice before entering that place.

Md_-YYvPYhUXBqSYo6w86A.text: Place was nice but the food didn't impress me as much. We ended up eating here because Tin Tin was closed for renovations.

AJLna9ReG-FHRR3Dm68Q6Q.text: The service was so fucking bad!the waitress didn't care about the customer,that was the worst waitress that I have ever MET!!

TxFU9hU_5YFRbdTA_4XvtQ.text: Hot buffet in typical Chinese buffet style. Only one selection of chicken wings which is a drawback to a chicken lover like myself.  Crab meat on French bread with cheese was delicious. Although it was lunch time while I was there a couple of the dishes that I tried with lukewarm to cold, which of the problems for something like egg rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Dragon Buffet - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Dragon Buffet - Charlotte, NC, United States

ozcbU_k27Fp3QXRF5JwCLg.text: This is the first buffet I have ever found that has the same quality food in a buffet as a take out Chinese restaurant. Yes, it's not high end, and yes these are not the highest quality ingredients...but that should never be reasons to go to a buffet! Everything we tried was great, and I think we tried everything! Very small in comparison to your big box buffets, but s probably why everything is so good. Nothing last too long on the warmers,so food is always fresh...sushi is great although very little variety. We have our new go to buffet when we want to have a little of everything

gDXcMiy_Q3OF7a8oIOZ-Bg.text: Still consistent and still decent, but I would say that I've experienced better. If you have a formula that works, stick to it. Since I started stopping by Dragon, the layout of the restaurant and the steam tables haven't changed. And more importantly, the food items haven't changed. They still offer a Black Pepper Pork and there are Barbecue Spare Ribs at dinner and the steamed dimsum and fried dumplings are there all day. Chicken & Broccoli and Lo Mein and such, too.  They've had a few platters of sushi - nothing more than California Rolls - occasionally.  With all of that said, there's a new player in town. Not even a mile further south is Jasmine Buffet which has more tables, better sushi and a cook-to-order hibachi grill with fresh veggies. Though it is a little more expensive there.

NlPNqnwbhe38CEKpsaVFLQ.text: My first time here and I must say it was Absolutely disgusting. This place should be SHUT DOWN. Everything was cold. Honestly, the best food item on the buffet was the ice cream.

G6UWB39tZtGX068OeQ0whw.text: Pretty good Chinese spot in Charlotte. Great food at a decent price. Fast service, enjoyable atmosphere and a nice selection of items.

bxPUIYmMsVJxosqsZ4L9BA.text: Good American Chinese food! Staff is always friendly. Food is always fresh. I prefer getting takeout because I'm not able to eat more than one plate when dining in, but if I get a takeout box I can have at least two meals for l about $10!!  It's a great price for good quality food and great service.   Great options: chicken wings, teriyaki chicken, green beans, Indian chicken, egg foo young...

lynZOC_UxkSfbrhRIC7UAg.text: Nastiest, cheapest buffet I have ever eaten at. I took a few bites and left. They still made me pay even though I didn't eat anything. I will never return to this place. There isn't anything to choose from either. It's a limited buffet.

ajvKUOaQyXbBJZAEguMPtg.text: Delicious!!!!!  Yes it is a buffet....excellent selection of meats, vegetables, and fried items. Soups were hot and fresh. I really enjoyed the fantasy chicken and spring rolls. The ribs and bourbon chicken were excellent. Service was attentive and restaurant is very clean.

eUpCTUU7R-2VxYGWeqOAnw.text: I am not a Chinese food lover, I eat only a few dishes so this review is specific to those.  Buffet: No generals chicken Sesame chicken tasted old, tough. Took only 2 bites. Bourbon chicken was pretty good. Sweet and sour chicken was pretty plain, as it normally is. Teriyaki chicken was good. Ribs were ok, sweet and sticky. Sugar donuts were dense.  Did not enjoy.  Not a huge buffet, but, they had some things I don't normally see.  Ckean, kept well stocked.

photos.caption: Photo of Dragon Buffet - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sampler plate from buffet offerings. Unfortunately,  no generals chicken. Did have ribs though.

nUAKAM6ZVbBOVE43QhRW9w.text: Got sat immediately for Sunday lunch. Service was good. Buffet has lots of options. Dumplings and Lo mein was good. Good seemed fresh.

ryXQSUvjvdzlMp5LlpscAA.text: A little gem in Charlotte. Was looking for a Chinese Buffet and the manager at the hotel I was at recommended Dragon Buffet. I am really glad he did. Two words to describe this restaurant would be clean and fresh.      It is located it a small strip mall across the parking lot from Walmart. It has a small parking lot with convenient spots.     I was greeted by the manager upon arrival and  escorted to my seat. Comfortable decor and friendly staff. My server asked for my beverage order and it was at my table upon my arrival from the buffet.       Now the food was the experience. The selections were all not your standard buffet grub. You had your regular selection of soups, but the wonton were fresh and steamed.  There was also a selection of beef and vegetable Dim Sum and lightly fried pork dumplings. Some of the assorted foods were Black Pepper Beef, Indian Chicken (spicy curry sauce), boneless spare ribs and egg foo young. They also have assorted seafood dishes. Dessert selections were standard and there was scoopable ice cream.     Restaurant serves PepsiCo products and has a limited beer and wine selection.      Overall restaurant was excellent and a value. Lunch price was $7.99 per person with dinner pricing at $8.99. They also offer to go at $4.25 a pound.

LU9rWjpmcJubQhKeWeDCWw.text: This is my favorite American Chinese in the area. Yes it's buffet but has a large menu to choose from.

OEATBmgou1VwUZyBFOVOlA.text: Decent is a fair word to describe Dragon Buffet food. My husband and I wanted to try this for somewhere different to go. The food was typical Chinese buffet quality for the most part. Buffet was kept cleaner than some I've been at. They had a tray of heavily buttered broccoli that was ok. Mushrooms we're ok. Spring rolls were good. I liked the breaded shrimp but hubby did not. I did have to wait longer than usual for the low mein to be replenished and when it finally was, I was disappointed in the flavor. It appeared that some of the food had been sitting out a long time and needed replaced... had that dry and absorbed look. We most likely won't be back here. We both agree that we'd try another new place instead.

OlPp0m1ukCgB9Bf9PVMRZQ.text: Love this place. Once a month we always order take out (2) orders of Beef with Broccoli with White rice, (1) order of chicken wings & crab rangoos. Love the taste!

58Ft5awVlaaA0zlJbMkY-w.text: It's ok there are better selections in the area for a Chinese buffet. Not terrible but basically it's pretty standard as far as food and service goes. Not a huge selection at all tho, they could of done better

HFOquq7i1f8RDW9WDZJhYg.text: Well I'm not a big fan of Chinese food in Charlotte so most buffets don't stand a chance with me.  However, this one has some decent items on the buffet.  The restaurant is busy during the lunch hour and parking is scarce as many times you have to cross over into the Wally World parking lot.  One item that stands out on this buffet is the hot and sour soup.  I could almost bathe in this as it is one of the best soups I've had.    One suggestion for the owners is to add more spicy selections.  One of my biggest complaints about all chinese restaurants is the lack of spice.  But this place is overall ok and I do come back here once in a while.

cZKtZ8JA0YsPsDhvPSfUWw.text: Good food for a buffet.  One of the better Chinese Buffets in the area.  This is not a place to go if you want sushi, because while they have it, it is not a center piece, but a after thought.    They have some of the better crab rangoons that I have had at any restaurant.  3 serving islands with hot food.  The popcorn butter shrimp is very good.  The Egg Drop soup is hit or miss, the days that it is on it is great, the days they are off, it is like yellow water.  I also recommend the pepper pork, Mongolian beef, and chicken and broccoli, as they are all good.    Of course my 4 year old son always wants to go because he gets the ice cream dessert.

tHG6zzi8L7GygA0i2g3ZHg.text: Went here for lunch for two people our total was $22.93 with drinks. I absolutely love their crab Ragoon. Loved their vegetable fried rice. Sesame chicken wasn't the best but it definitely wasn't the worst, I've had a lot nastier so nothing really special there. Same for the Lo mein- not the best nor the worst. The buffet was kept clean and seemed organized.  They don't have a big selection for fruit or dessert so that was kinda disappointing for a sweet tooth like myself. **They did have ice cream so I wasn't to upset!**  They are very welcoming and felt right at home. Never a dirty dish if I went to the buffet and returned and always had our drinks refilled.   We aren't from around this area so if you have an IPhone and use the built in GPS you may end up back on the interstate. You can easily miss the turn which isn't the buffets  fault and didn't affect my rating whatsoever just putting that out there for travelers!  My biggest disappointment is it wasn't really cool inside, yeah it's a buffet and the steaming hot food makes it hotter inside but still, we sat a little ways away and it wasn't really cool either way.   I would definitely come back! Thanks for the good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Dragon Buffet - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yum! Crab ragoon! (On the left)
Photo of Dragon Buffet - Charlotte, NC, United States. That&#39;s their selection for fruit and dessert.

MREl-Xx_GelNj7O06p_GhA.text: This buffet is small but the food is better than most other buffets in the area. The food is not overtly oily. There usually isn't a wait during lunch time even though it's always busy. Great service. No hibachi grill. Not a wide variety of sushi but it's very well done. They cook the sushi rice perfectly. I order take out more often now. The portions are huge it's actually the best value for chinese food in town. Would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Dragon Buffet - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Dragon Buffet - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Dragon Buffet - Charlotte, NC, United States

rf7KvGH6aI7bIxvvwWHUPg.text: Unfortunately this buffet is no longer as good as it was. We've gone a handful of times over the past year and have felt nauseous soon after leaving. The food appears and tastes the same, but if both of us feel this way then something is different. Not sure what.

pvOqzkIWbn0Y7Oi62rDplQ.text: The first word that pops in my mind is DINGY!!!  This place looks like the interior hasn't been updated since they first opened.  Dark, too small to be a good buffet and now I understand why a dinner buffet is only $8.99.  Food:  Good flavor but very limited options.  Only about 4 steam tables and a lot of standard things that you see on most buffets are missing.    Cleanliness:  Dirty silverware on the table that I had to complain about.  Had to get new silverware and ask the waiter for a cup of hot water to kill any germs on the silverware.  Service:  Never checked on during our meal and never offered a refill on our drinks.  Bottom line is that this is not the best buffet that I've gone to.  They need to move to a bigger and nicer location or close down and renovate this place from top to bottom.  The decor killed my appetite, had one plate and was done.

6WomPbhD66yJIhv_g04dXw.text: Typical Chinese buffet, nothing special, in fact we didn't like it much at all. We have had better. Some items were very salty. The restaurant want very clean either.

qU8dzN8YcVUBo9pB8bIc5A.text: I really hate to downgrade my review of this place but I just cannot with the consistent poor sanitation scores. Over the last several months the score has gone down and reading the violations online are pretty gross. I just tried to go today to get my favorite salmon and the score is 91 as of 1/10/19. The violations include cross contamination of raw meat and cooked meat, lack of hand washing, and scooping ice with an exposed cut finger. I don't even feel comfortable eating here anymore.

9KMMBDpWAsituwYADI0ITQ.text: Everything was just bland and tasted extremely greasy. Stomach ache began to set in before leaving restaurant. Service was really fast. Constantly picked up used plates and made sure our cups were full.  Seems like they were constantly refilling the buffet. However they did try to over charge our party by charging adult prices for kids after asking for their ages. Great price but it's not worth it at all.

O1EaJFYW0PX78RX3jq2kYQ.text: Wasn't worth the trip. Most of the food was cold to just meh warm. The place looks nice from the outside but hardly any customers that trickle in thru  out the evening and I arrived at dinner time.  The bathroom toilets all didn't work so lots of debris left over from other customers.   Service is inattentive.

AO8ky7leWQSGr4K9xRia5w.text: Decent good, excellent service. We enjoy dining out for lunch when in the area. There is a good variety of food, and the buffet bars are kept stocked and clean. I love all the chicken and shrimp dishes, but always save room for ice cream to finish off the meal!

fGygFW_2NDyEPHKqbqpMsw.text: I don't have a clue how long this place has been in business but I've been eating here for years. Some one commented on the place not being good because it's a small buffet and not one of the mega "stuff-an-pukes" buffets with food sitting around in warming pans for hours on end.  Yes, they have a limited selection and the warming pans are small so sometimes they may be out of something for a few minutes. But that doesn't happen very often. I would much rather have that than the hog trough pans  used in the mega buffets with food that's been sitting around for hours on end that all taste the same ... like crap!  Fast turnover and quality food, that's what makes this a consistently good buffet.  Are there bigger Chinese buffets in Charlotte? Yes, of course. Are there BETTER buffets in Charlotte? I'm sure there probably are. But I haven't found one in years!

BslsaXqTdzJG2PidWIOe0Q.text: Typical, run of the mill, Chinese buffet that you would expect on any hot buffet line anywhere in the good ole US of A.   The place was 100% full and ultra busy on a Saturday at lunch, ensuring good quick food turn over.  The servers are pleasant and hustle.  The manager would die if he cracked a smile.    Listen up HATERS, it is $7.99 for lunch, get over yourself, it is down and dirty, nothing fancy........  Some notes:  1.  Sushi is below average and nasty.    2.  The black pepper pork is actually terrific, its a sweet pepper sauce, I have never had anything like it.  3.  The Vietnamese Rolls are interesting, kind of like a Mexican beef taqiuito, but with an Asian spill.   Really good.    4.  Crab meat and cheese casserole was pretty good, especially when you scoop it on the French buttered bread.  5.  The buttered fried shrimp were tasty.  That is all folks, have a RICE day!  :-)

j98lLpRqBW8yN4RbNAbyUA.text: surprisingly good... did not think Charlotte had a good Chinese place, because most of the Vietnamese and asian-mix food places have been bad.  pho doan - pho hoa - and dragon buffet are the only places worth sitting down to eat at.

pMz7iWVKRxqJAZi-N0HWvQ.text: Empty on a Friday night. Food was 3/10. My husband had an allergic reaction (shrimp allergy) from eating chicken - meaning they don't follow health codes and cook shellfish separately. Sanitation grade 93%. We should have left the moment we walked in. Don't go here

Yy_aExjSrKjAyEBx6HfNWw.text: This will be my Buffet spot, it is like regular Chinese buffet but has great food everything tasted fresh and hot. Their fried rice and fried potatoes look so yummy it does not look greasy and cheap like in most Chinese buffet. Loved the ice cream selection Strawberry, chocolate, vanilla and Oreo   The place is very clean and the service is very welcoming!  Also a good price for a buffet our bill was about $21 for the adults dinner and one soft drink !!! It can not get better than that for the quality!!

photos.caption: Photo of Dragon Buffet - Charlotte, NC, United States. To get the best taste out of a Wonton soup add one slice of lemon salt to your taste and the green onions !! It&#39;s a must!! Yumm
Photo of Dragon Buffet - Charlotte, NC, United States. Try the eggs and tomato it&#39;s a bit sweet but it goes delicious with some white rice!!!
Photo of Dragon Buffet - Charlotte, NC, United States

7PBaL1QbqZbVNAbNzuMGSw.text: I came here for a Sunday lunch buffet.  It was decent for the price.  Nothing was bad, just ok.  I particularly liked the sesame chicken and some of the desserts.  They have about 3-4 bars to choose from and it's really what you would expect from a typical buffet.  I wouldn't recommend trying the sushi! Just stay away from buffet sushi and you'll be fine.  The food coming out was hot and they are constantly refreshing it.  The service was good and the waiter was attentive with clearing plates and getting refills.  A lot of food for the price!

AaB0e65N_2AjTttlJKQKog.text: As far as Chinese buffet's go this is probably the best one in Charlotte. I have been coming here for years. The food always has good flavors. I took off a star because the food isn't always hot (a chronic buffet problem, I know). This is great for lunch or dinner. They are reasonably priced and the staff is friendly. If I want buffett, I want Dragon Buffet.

C6B5O-sqbV1pg1kLFNDbcw.text: This restaurant never disappoints. I've tried other larger buffets, but the food quality was not as good as Dragon Buffet. Especially love the Dim Sum and Vietnamese Rolls. The staff is always nice and friendly. Love this place!

jmk4OZ7gv9XBHhl4nLeM6w.text: I rarely judge a Chinese buffet by atmosphere but 5 feet in the door and I was like, "Uh oh". It's odd not to see a 30 foot wide mural of a pagoda on the wall or Chinese music playing loudly on the sound system. Not here. It feels like this place just took over the spot yesterday. Anyway, on to the food. It basically has 3 8-foot serving buffets for entrees and 1 more for desserts (possibly the smallest buffet I've ever seen). Quite odd were 2 small plates of sushi rolls sitting in the middle of the dessert table with no sushi station (or chef) to be seen. They looked like California rolls you'd walk into Harris-Teeter and buy (but not even that quality). 6pm dinner and the place was fairly empty (which is good because if this place got slammed, they would be out of food in 10 minutes). I did see an unusually high number of walk-in traffic filling up take out containers (which you'd think is a good sign). I will say the hot and sour soup was a highlight. Everything else was meh. I did not see General Tso's or Beef and Broccoli (common buffet staples). The egg roll was mush. The overall temperature of all our food was "just a little warm" (which seems to be a consistent comment on here). You're basically down to green beans and picking broccoli out of a chicken dish if you want a vegetable. The salmon was cut up into little 2" x 2" squares (weird, maybe they are just portioning it or the buffet can't hold normal salmon fillets like other buffets serve it). I could go on and on. I can just honestly say I've never walked out of a place knowing I won't be back.

WQzYALOzMKxpTodGwtPgWg.text: This place wins the award for Charlotte's Worst Chinese Buffet. Do not waste your money. You can find a better Chinese buffet anywhere else. The cashier was less than pleasant, the restaurant itself is dingy and dark, and the lack of options make this buffet a last option. The food was average and overall unimpressive. Definitely won't return.

Zh4vq2htSRzLT5tBAZiNFA.text: One of my fav buffets in Charlotte. The Vietnamese rolls and Chicken/Broccoli are the best!   Ambiance: Nice and Cozy, albeit a lil' dim. Booth and Table seating availability.  Customer service: Some of the waitresses have language barriers, but they do their best to accommodate you, even if that means bringing over the owner.  Food: Consistently hot, fresh and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Dragon Buffet - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vietnamese Rolls and Chicken/Broccoli over fried rice
